'N-Methylethanolamine' is an alkanolamine and a toxic, flammable, corrosive,
colorless, viscous liquid. It is the biochemical precursor of choline.

With both an amine and an hydroxyl functional groups, it is a useful
intermediate in the chemical synthesis of various products including polymers
and pharmaceuticals. It is also used as a solvent, for example in the natural
gas-processing industry together with its analogs ethanolamine and
dimethylethanolamine.

N-Methylethanolamine can be prepared by the reaction of ethylene oxide with
methylamine.
